docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ABOUT THE CONSTITUTION Six authorities on constitutional rights will take part in a series of programs celebrating the 200th birthday of the Constitution, beginning this week at Sarah Lawrence College in Yonkers. Barbara Black, dean of the law faculty at Columbia University, leads off at 7 P.M. Tuesday with a discussion of ''The Constitution in United States History.

docs.snippet: LEAD: These Amazons now showed themselves qualified for the duty even of foot-soldiers; they stood there till 5 in the afternoon, without either sustenance or evacuation, every now and then playing volleys of thumps, kicks and raps, against the do...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: These Amazons now showed themselves qualified for the duty even of foot-soldiers; they stood there till 5 in the afternoon, without either sustenance or evacuation, every now and then playing volleys of thumps, kicks and raps, against the door, with so much violence that the speakers in the House were scarce heard.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ANTONIO ZUMEL, a negotiator for the Communist insurgents in the Philippines, returned to the underground 10 days ago when the already faltering peace talks with the Government of President Corazon C. Aquino broke down. Mr. Zumel said his life had been threatened.
